headline: Air Fryer Sweet Potato Fries
description: These crispy air fryer sweet potato fries, seasoned with garlic and paprika, are simply addictive and take only 10 minutes to cook.

video.name: How to Make Air Fryer Sweet Potato Fries

name: Air Fryer Sweet Potato Fries

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Cut sweet potato into 1/2-inch wide fries. Place in a bowl with canola oil; toss to coat. Season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika; mix until all fries are evenly coated.
Working in batches if necessary, place an even layer of fries in the air fryer basket.
Cook in the preheated air fryer until golden, about 10 minutes. Repeat to cook remaining fries.

review.reviewBody: 10 minutes was not long enough.

These were great! Soaked in cold water for 10, dried them thoroughly before coating with oil. Created a variation on the 3rd batch: Garlic Parmesan Crusted Sweet Potato Fries Added 1/4 cup grated Parmesan Bumped up garlic powder to 1.5 tsp Used regular paprika instead of sweet Cut out the salt and pepper. The Parmesan was salty enough for me Tossed the fries and air fried them in a ninja foodi for 10 minutes. I cut my fries thin so they fried better. Thick ones were super soft in the center.

I read reviews of soggy fries and researched how to avoid it. I soaked the potato sticks in water for 15-20 minutes until I was ready to start making the fries. I probably could have soaked them for less time as you could see the starch in the water within just a few minutes. The key was to COMPLETELY dry the fries before coating with oil. I shook them a few times during cooking to check for doneness. I had cut them really thin so I wasn't sure about the time. They came out crisp and delicious. It is a new family favorite!
Great as is

These were delicious! I did soak them in cold water as one reviewer suggested. That did not make them crispy. I did not have sweet paprika so I used regular. I added 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon. I was so glad I did. Mine were a bit on the spicy side which I attribute to the paprika. I will try them again without it but continue to use the cinnamon and maybe add 1/2 tsp brown sugar. I like my baked sweet potato with brown sugar and cinnamon. I also put them in a ziploc bag. Great idea!
I love this simple seasoning on these sweet potato fries. A delicious side with any entree.

Didn't have the garlic powder but forged ahead anyway. Made sure I pressed the shake button to give em the ol razzle dazzle then. Oh, I also soaked the slices for 10ish minutes before tossing them in batches into the avocado oil/paprika/salt/pepper mix. Tasty... thank you
Maybe I did something wrong (timing, maybe) but these didn't come out crispy for me. The outer layer was chewy.

I loved this recipe. It was quick and easy. I will make a few adjustments next time. I am new to the air fryer and mine weren't quite as crunchy as I would have liked but they were delicious. The flavor was good. I added a praline dipping sauce. I will definitely try this recipe again and I have already shared it.
Easy recipe. I did not cut the potatoes thick and they needed to air fry at least 15-20 mins. I will try again!

It's healthy, less fat than deep frying. Easy to make and cheaper than ordering them when out to eat. I substituted avocado oil for the canola oil. I did the 10 minute cooking of them, turning them half way. Hard to tell because of the spice coating if the fries were getting browned, so I kept them in for 2 more minutes. They were cooked and tasty, but were not really crisp. Don't know if that's how they come out or if I needed to cook them longer. They taste great, tho!
Everyone loved these! Great balance of seasoning, and super easy. I'm not a fan of sweet potato fries and I liked them! Thank you!

I soaked mine in water for 10 minutes and patted dry before adding the oil and spices. It took another 7 minutes on the time to get a bit of crisp. 
That being said, the spice combo on these fries is FANTASTIC. compliments the sweet potatoes beautifully.
Loved them! I used olive oil instead of the other oil and because I don't use a lot of salt; I cut it in 1/2.
Very good!

These had good flavor, but they did not crisp, even though I let them air fry longer until they started getting dark. I tried twice with the same results. 
A suggestion I'll try next is tossing the cut fries in Corn Starch before tossing in salt and oil, then adding the other spices after cooking. That might actually work to crisp these air fried sweet potato fries.
Really good! Tonight makes 2 nights in a row I’m making this. I do eye my seasoning though instead of measuring out.
These turned out perfect and absolutely delicious! Best sweet potato fries I've ever eaten!
This makes for some nice crisp fries with practically zero oil!
I had to put the fries in for a bit more cooking, 10 minutes per batch and then 5 minutes altogether.
Kind of bland and they sweet potatoes were not crispy.

Taste was there but a tip on Sweet Potato CRISPINESS for everyone - 
1. Slice your fries thinly.
2. Toss your fries in Cornstarch before adding the seasonings and oil.

Voila - the CRISP factor!
Delicious as is!
Loved it!! My husband ate the first batch before the 2nd finished cooking

Keeper recipe! I had two big sweet potatoes and did two batches to cook the fries in single layers. I used a maple & garlic spice on the fries which was amazing! If you've got some maple sugar, sprinkle some on the sweet potato fries with the other spices. Thanks for a great recipe!

no changes.
The fries weren't very crispy. Could be my air fryer.
The fries were not crispy at all.
First thing I've made in our new air fryer. Followed the recipe exactly & wouldn't change a thing. Perfect!!! Honestly, Better than deep fried or baked. These are fantastic!
I lengthened the time because I cut the fries a little bigger but otherwise followed the recipe and had perfect fries. Totally enjoyed them.
Pretty good. Not as crispy as I like on the outside. Will play around with temperature.

I actually made yam fries as did most of the people on this recipe. The light yellow fries are actually the sweet potato, orange are yams.
They were good, not to crispy as most have reported, but the yam has a lot of moisture in it, so. I used a little olive oil and cajun seasoning along with salt and pepper.
Felt the heat was too hot after 5 minutes or so, so I turned it down to 375 so I wouldn't have dark fries.
Overall quick, easy and good. Will make again.
Simple and delicious! I ate the first batch without sharing. LOL.
I made these sweet potato fries and they turned out delicious! I did cut them into super thin strips. They turned out super crispy that way! Thank you for the recipe!
Easy, delicious, quick, yummmmm.

I took another person’s review advice and soaked the fries for 10 min before seasoning and cooking. I turned the heat down just a smidge so they would not burn on the outside. I just kept and eye on them and took them out when they started getting some char on the outside. These turned out great. Kids and husband love them.
Delicious but not crispy. Cook for only 10/minutes.

Love sweet potato fries and these turned out well. I used EVOO out of preference and only have smoked paprika. The cooking time for my fryer was more like 18-20 minutes turning them half way. I just watched them till they were nicely dark, but not burnt. They came out soft on the inside but retained a firm crust which was pleasant. A bit of chili powder or cayenne would go well for a kick. Will make these again

This was my very first recipe to try in my new air fryer (Tefal Ultimate Fry) I don't know if it was because I used Vegetable Oil instead of Canola Oil, but they turned out quite soggy :( I also used garlic salt instead of garlic powder as I didn't have any. I'll try what someone else suggested next time and soak them in water first.
These are so, so good. Yum! I made them exactly as written; didn’t change a thing. Thank you for the recipe.

I'm new to using an air fryer. These turned out a bit soggy and not crisp. But that may have been due to my technique. So I will try at least a couple more times to get them to come our crisp. The flavor was very good. The seasoning mixture was just right for the sweet potatoes.

These were good, but still not as crispy as I would like. I followed one reviewers suggestion of soaking the potato fries in water first. I soaked for at least a half hour and still not real crispy. I'm thinking there is no way to make sweet potato fries crispy other than actually deep frying. This is still a good option.
Followed the recipe but not crispy except for the burnt parts. Will try soaking it before frying next time as someone suggested.
Easy, addicting and healthy.
I enjoyed making theses simple fries but with a great taste.
Great recipe! Turned out perfectly!
Made by recipe listed - no changes. YUMMY!!!
Happy, happy me. Sweet potatoes turned out awesome. Thanks
This came out great, highly recommended. You can do an average sized sweet potato in one round rather than the two or three in the recipe.
Perfect! Will be making these often.
Thank you very much for such an easy and satisfying recipe! The one modification I did was to cut the sweet potato, then soak the fries in water for at least 10 minutes, to make them more crispy.

I just bought a small air fryer and this was the first item I cooked in it. I followed the recipe as is, except I used regular salt instead of Kosher salt (didn't have any). Turned out great! I adjusted the time according to the size of the batches. Instead of adding all the ingredients in a bowl, I put them all in a large baggy and shook it up. Easy cleanup. My husband (who's the biggest fan for sweet potatoes) loved them and asked for them to be made again the next day. Thank you for the recipe.
So delicious! I played with the size of the fries and added 30 seconds frying time to get them crispy.
Turned out great!
Fantastic!
Tried sweet potato fries in the air fryer several different ways. This one was the best by far!
Delish! I dusted mine with cinnamon sugar. SO GOOD!
